question: Which is the largest country in South America?
explanation: Brazil is the largest country in South America. Its capital is Brasilia. The official language is Portuguese. It is the fifth-largest country in the world by area with 8515767 sq.km. It is the sixth most populous country in the world. It borders all the countries of South America except Chile and Ecuador. Uruguay to the south; Argentina and Paraguay to the south-west; Bolivia and Peru to the west; Columbia to the north-west; Venezuela, Guyana and Suriname to the north of Brazil.
